TENSES.topic: Temel Zaman Kuralları ve Kritik Uyarılar

content.rule: for two days, all day, throughout the year gibi süreç ifade eden zaman ifadeleri varsa 'Ving' cevap olamaz.
examples: She worked all day. ✅
She was working all day. ❌

content.rule: V0 - V1 yapıları If clause ve zaman bağlaçlarında otomatik gelecek zaman göndermesi yapar.
content.formula: If/when/before + S + V1, S + will V0

content.rule: If/when/before'dan sonra 'will, would, shall, be going to' gelmez.
examples: If it rains, we will stay inside. ✅
If it will rain, we will stay inside. ❌

content.title: Present Simple (V1)
content.rule: Sıklık ifadeleri ve tarihsel köken (date back to, go back to) için kullanılır.
examples: She always drinks tea.
This building dates back to the 18th century.

content.title: Present Continuous (am/is/are Ving)
content.rule: now, right now, nowadays, at the moment, look/listen, for the time being.
examples: She is talking on the phone right now.

content.title: Past Continuous (was/were Ving)
content.rule: at that time, at the time, at that moment.
examples: At that time, he was living abroad.

content.title: Present Perfect (have/has V3)
content.rule: up to now, up till/until now, for ten years now, three times.
examples: I have lived here for ten years now.
I have visited Paris three times.

content.title: Future Simple (will V0)
content.rule: from now on, onward, onwards, tomorrow, next..., shortly, soon.
examples: From now on, we will study harder.

content.title: Süreç Belirten be Ving
content.rule: gradually, more and more, day by day.
examples: She is becoming more confident day by day.

content.rule: yesterday, ... ago, last ..., in 1900, during WW2, once gibi ifadelerle kullanılır.
examples: They visited Rome last summer.

content.title: V2'nin Geçmiş Anlamı VERMEDİĞİ Yapılar
content.rule: Bu kalıplardan sonra V2 gelirse güncel/hayali anlam taşır:
examples: It’s about time we left.
I wish I had more time.
He acts as if he knew everything.
I’d rather you stayed home tonight.
If I had money, I would buy a car.
Would you mind if I used your pen?

content.title: was/were Ving Sadece 2 Dizilimde Kullanılır
examples: was/were Ving, V2 (When/While)
was/were Ving, was/were Ving (While/As)

content.title: Edat Olarak Since (-den beri)
content.rule: Since + pointed time in the past / noun phrase, have/has (been) V3.
examples: Since 2010, she has lived here.
They have been married since college.

content.title: Bağlaç Olarak Since
content.rule: (Ever) Since + V2 (yan cümle), have/has (been) V3 (ana cümle).
examples: Ever since she left, I have felt lonely.
He has worked here ever since he graduated.

content.title: Zarf Olarak Since
content.rule: Öncesinde kesin V2 olacak; and/but veya nokta sonrası have/has (been) V3.
examples: She moved to London, and since then she has lived there.

content.rule: by pointed time in the past + had V3
examples: By 1990, they had finished the project.

content.rule: by the time V2, had V3
examples: By the time she arrived, he had left.

content.rule: DİKKAT: Had V3'ü after/as soon as/once'ın ikinci kısmında; before/by the time'ın ilk kısmında görürsen ele!
examples: As soon as he had eaten, he went to bed.
He had left before she arrived.

content.title: Had V3 ile Özel Yapılar
examples: I wish I had studied harder.
He acted as if he had seen a ghost.
I’d rather you had told me the truth.
If she had listened, she would have succeeded (Type 3).

TENSES.topic: By ve By the Time Ayrımı

content.rule: By 1960 -> had V3 | By 2060 -> will have V3
By the time V2 (past) -> had V3
By the time V1 (present) -> will have V3
examples: By the time she arrives, I will have prepared dinner.

content.title: İlk Boşlukta Olmazlar
content.rule: will, would, shall, be going to, may, might.

content.title: İkinci Boşlukta Olmazlar
content.rule: have/has V3, have/has been Ving, V2, was/were Ving, had V3, am/is/are.
Cümle Superlative ile başlıyorsa -> V2 yüksek ihtimal.
examples: The best moment of my life was when I met her.

content.rule: This is ... + superlative şeklindeyse -> have/has V3.
examples: This is the best book I have read.

content.rule: Three times -> have/has V3 | Three times a day -> V1 (Geniş Zaman).

content.title: Present
content.rule: can V0 ⇒ am/is/are able to V0
examples: She can swim fast.
He is able to solve the problem.

content.title: Future
content.rule: will be able to V0 ⇒ shall be able to V0
examples: You will be able to join us tomorrow.
We shall be able to finish it on time.

content.title: Past
content.rule: could V0 ⇒ was/were able to V0
examples: She could run 10 km.
They were able to escape the fire.

content.title: Present Possibility (Olumlu)
content.rule: may / might / could V0 (may well / might well / could well ihtimali güçlendirir).
examples: She may come later.
He may well win the race.
It might well rain today.

content.rule: DİKKAT: may/might as well (bari yapalım anlamı katar).
examples: We may as well leave now.

content.rule: be likely to V0 (muhtemel) / be bound to V0 (kesin/kaçınılmaz).
examples: She is likely to fail.
He is bound to make mistakes.

content.title: Present Possibility (Olumsuz)
content.rule: may not V0 / might not V0 kullanılır. DİKKAT: couldn’t V0 bu anlamda kullanılmaz!
examples: She may not pass.
They might not attend.

content.title: Past Possibility (Geçmiş İhtimal)
content.rule: may have V3 / might have V3 / could have V3 (olumlu/olumsuz).
examples: She may have forgotten the key.
He might have left early.
She might not have known that.

content.title: Requests
content.rule: Can you... / Could you... / Will you... / Would you...
examples: Could you help me with this?
Would you join us for dinner?

content.rule: Would you mind + Ving? / Would you mind if + S + V2?
examples: Would you mind closing the door?
Would you mind if I sat here?

content.title: Permissions
content.rule: May I / Might I / Can I / Could I
examples: May I leave early?
Could I borrow your book?

content.title: Zorundayım (Present)
content.rule: must V0 / have-has to V0 / have-has got to V0 / need to V0.

content.title: Zorundaydım (Past)
content.rule: had to V0.
examples: He had to leave early.

content.title: Zorunda Değilim
content.rule: don’t have to / haven't got to / don’t need to (Past: didn’t need to).
examples: You don’t have to wait.

content.title: Tavsiye (Advice)
content.rule: should / ought to / had better / must V0 (Olumsuz: shouldn't / ought not to / had better not / mustn't).

content.title: Çıkarım (Present Deduction)
content.rule: Olumlu: must V0 (olmalı) / Olumsuz: can’t V0 (olamaz).
examples: He must be tired.
She can’t be serious.

content.title: Çıkarım (Past Deduction)
content.rule: Olumlu: must have V3 / Olumsuz: can’t-couldn’t have V3.
examples: He must have forgotten.
She couldn’t have known that.

content.title: Alışkanlıklar
content.rule: am-is-are used to + Ving (alışkın olmak) / used to V0 (eskiden yapardım).
examples: I am used to working late.
I used to play football.

content.title: Tercihler
content.rule: would rather V0 (THAN V0) / prefer something (TO something).
examples: I would rather stay home.
I prefer tea to coffee.
He would rather walk than drive.

content.title: Yasak (Prohibition)
content.rule: mustn’t / am-is-are not allowed to / be forbidden to / be banned to / be prohibited to.

content.title: Yasak değil ama yapma
content.rule: am-is-are not supposed to / am-is-are not to / shouldn’t / ought not to.

content.title: Beklenti (Expectation)
content.rule: am-is-are to V0 / am-is-are supposed to V0 (Past: was-were supposed to).
examples: You are to report at 9 a.m.
He was supposed to arrive at noon.

MODALS.topic: Regret & Unreal Structures (Pişmanlık ve Gerçek Dışı)

content.title: Past Advice / Regret
content.rule: should have V3 / ought to have V3 (yapmalıydı ama yapmadı).
examples: You should have called me.
You shouldn’t have shouted.

content.title: Missed Opportunity
content.rule: could have V3 (yapabilirdi ama yapmadı).
examples: I could have helped you.

content.title: Unreal Yapılar
content.rule: was-were going to V0 (yapacaktı yapmadı) / needn’t have V3 (gerek yoktu ama yaptı).
Nesne alabilen fiiller (kimi, neyi sorularına cevap veren) pasif yapılabilir.
examples: They cleaned the room → The room was cleaned.

content.rule: DİKKAT: Soruda nesne alması gereken bir fiil varsa ve yanında nesne yoksa, o yapı pasiftir.
examples: The window was broken. (Kıran belli değil, nesne olan pencere özne olmuş.)

content.title: Passive Yapma Formülü
content.formula: S + V + O ⇒ O + BE V3
examples: She writes a letter ⇒ A letter is written.

content.title: V1 (Present Simple)
content.rule: am/is/are + V3
examples: The car is washed.

content.title: V2 (Past Simple)
content.rule: was/were + V3
examples: The car was washed.

content.title: Modals + V0
content.rule: modal + be + V3
examples: The job must be done.

content.title: Continuous (Ving)
content.rule: be + being + V3
examples: The cake is being baked.

content.title: Perfect (V3)
content.rule: have/has/had + been + V3
examples: The letter has been sent.

content.title: Infinitive (to V0)
content.rule: to be V3 / to have been V3
examples: The report needs to be finished.
He claims to have been cheated.

content.title: Gerund (Ving)
content.rule: being V3 / having been V3
examples: He admitted being followed.
She regrets having been ignored.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra EDAT (with/to/at/by vb.) geliyorsa ⇒ PASİF
examples: The room was filled with smoke.

content.rule: Cümle 'It .... THAT' yapısıyla kurulmuşsa ⇒ PASİF
examples: It is believed that he escaped.

content.rule: Noktalama işaretlerinden (, / . / ;) hemen önce ⇒ PASİF
examples: He was arrested; the evidence was found.

content.rule: ZARF kullanımından sonra nesne yoksa ⇒ PASİF
examples: Surprisingly, the task was completed on time.

content.rule: Duygular ve dış kaynaklı olaylar genellikle pasiftir.
examples: She was shocked by the result.

content.rule: İSTİSNA: is seen / was caught / was found + Ving dizilimine dikkat!
examples: He was seen leaving the building.

content.rule: by (tarafından)
examples: The novel was written by Orwell.

content.rule: with the help of (yardımıyla)
examples: The machine was built with the help of engineers.

content.rule: via / through (aracılığıyla)
examples: The message was sent via email.
Data was obtained through observation.

content.rule: by means of (vasıtasıyla)
examples: The solution was reached by means of negotiation.

content.title: Sadece Eylem Odaklı (Nesne Ortada)
content.rule: HAVE / GET + Something + V3
examples: I had my bike fixed.
She got the documents printed.

content.title: Eylemi Yapan Kişi Odaklı (Aktif Dizilim)
content.rule: HAVE / LET / MAKE + Somebody + V0
examples: I had the mechanic check the brakes.
She let her friend borrow her car.
The teacher made the students stay late.

content.title: İSTİSNA: GET Kullanımı
content.rule: GET + Somebody + TO V0
examples: I got the mechanic to check the brakes.

content.rule: Genel durumlara veya geçmişe gönderme yapan fiillerle (like, hate, steal, witness, remember, regret) kullanılır.
examples: I remember stealing that book when I was a kid.
She likes reading novels.

content.rule: Tüm Edatlardan (PREP) sonra Ving gelir.
examples: He is good at drawing.
They talked about moving abroad.

content.rule: go + Ving (aktivite bildiren fiiller).
examples: They went swimming last weekend.
We often go hiking.

content.title: Idiomatic Expressions (Kalıplaşmış İfadeler)
content.rule: be/get used to, be/get accustomed to, look forward to, feel like, be opposed to, object to, can’t help/bear/stand, It’s worth, no use/good, there is no point in, in the habit of.
examples: I’m used to waking up early.
She looks forward to meeting you.
There’s no point in arguing.

content.rule: Sahiplik bildiren (Possessive) yapılardan sonra Ving gelir.
examples: I appreciate your helping me.
His singing was impressive.

content.rule: spend / waste + zaman/para + Ving.
examples: He spent two hours studying.
She wasted time complaining.

content.rule: trouble / problem / difficulty + Ving.
examples: They had trouble finding a taxi.

content.rule: DİKKAT: busy (İstisna Sıfat) ve is seen/caught/found (İstisna Pasif) yapılarından sonra Ving gelir.
examples: He is busy preparing dinner.
He was caught stealing a phone.

content.rule: see / hear (eylemin bir kısmına şahit olma).
examples: I saw him running.
We heard the baby crying.

content.title: Gerund Pasif Hali
content.rule: being V3 / having been V3
examples: She hates being ignored.
He mentioned being chosen for the role.

content.rule: Geleceğe veya bir amaca gönderme yapan fiillerle (plan, hope, decide, want) kullanılır.
examples: I plan to visit Italy.
They decided to move.

content.rule: ADJ + to V0 yapısı.
examples: It’s easy to learn English.
He was happy to help.

content.title: Sıfat Dizilimleri
content.rule: adj + for/of + SMB + to V0
examples: It’s difficult for children to focus.
It was kind of her to offer help.

content.rule: Noun + to V0.
examples: She has a lot of work to do.

content.rule: too ... to V0 / adj-adv + enough + to V0 / enough + noun + to V0.
examples: This tea is too hot to drink.
She’s old enough to vote.
There isn't enough time to finish.

content.rule: Question Word + to V0 (if hariç).
examples: I don’t know what to do.
Tell me how to use this machine.

content.rule: something/anybody/nothing + to V0.
examples: I need something to eat.

content.rule: Superlative + to V0 (en ... ecek olan).
examples: He’s the best player to join the team.

content.rule: AMAÇ bildiren (mek/mak için) kullanım.
examples: She studies hard to pass the exam.

content.title: Infinitive Pasif Hali
content.rule: to be V3
examples: The house needs to be cleaned.
The book is expected to be published soon.

GERUNDS & INFINITIVES.topic: Her İki Yapıyı Alan ve Anlamı Değişen Fiiller (BOTH)

content.title: MEAN
content.rule: Gerund: anlamına gelmek | Infinitive: kastetmek
examples: This word means learning something.
I meant to call you yesterday.

content.title: TRY
content.rule: Gerund: denemek | Infinitive: çabalamak
examples: Try restarting the computer.
I tried to fix the issue.

content.title: STOP
content.rule: Gerund: eylemi bırakmak (give up) | Infinitive: bir şey yapmak için durmak
examples: He stopped smoking. (Bıraktı)
She stopped to rest. (Durdu)

content.title: FORGET / REMEMBER
content.rule: Gerund: yapılan eylemi unutmak/hatırlamak | Infinitive: yapılacak eylemi
examples: I remember seeing her. (Gördüğümü hatırlıyorum)
Remember to turn off lights. (Kapatmayı unutma)

content.title: REGRET
content.rule: Gerund: yaptığına pişman olmak | Infinitive: üzülerek bildirmek
examples: I regret telling him.
We regret to inform you that...

content.title: GO ON
content.rule: Gerund: aynı şeye devam etmek | Infinitive: değişiklik yaparak devam etmek
examples: He went on talking for hours.
She went on to explain the details.

content.title: NEED
content.rule: Gerund: pasif anlam (temizlik istiyor) | Infinitive: aktif anlam (temizlemem lazım)
examples: The car needs washing.
I need to wash the car.

ADJECTIVES & ADVERBS.topic: Sıfat ve Zarf Ayrımı (ADJ vs ADV)

content.title: ADJECTIVES (ADJ)
content.rule: İsimleri niteler. Ancak şu fiiller istisna olarak zarf yerine sıfatla nitelenir: be, look, become, feel, taste, prove, get, smell, remain, sound, seem, stay, appear.
examples: The soup tastes good.
He seems happy.

content.title: ADVERBS (ADV)
content.rule: Zarflar şunları niteler: Fiiller, Sıfatlar, Cümleler ve Diğer Zarflar.
examples: Fiili niteleme: She speaks slowly.
Sıfatı niteleme: The exam was extremely easy.
Cümleyi niteleme: Unfortunately, we lost.
Zarfı niteleme: She drives extremely carefully.

content.title: KRİTİK İPUCU
content.rule: Cümlede boş bırakılan yer hariç anlam bütünlüğü ve gramer tam ise; Even, Comparatives, Superlatives veya bir ADVERB (Zarf) seçeneğine yönel.
-er THAN (kısa kelimeler) / more ... THAN (uzun kelimeler).
examples: She is taller than her brother.
This book is more interesting than the last one.

content.title: Özel Karşılaştırmalar
content.rule: The former (önceki) / the latter (sonraki).
examples: I met Jane and Sarah. The former is a teacher, the latter is a doctor.

content.rule: The more ..., the more ... (Ne kadar ..., o kadar ...).
examples: The more you practice, the better you become.

content.rule: as ... adj/adv ... as (kadar) / so ... as (olumsuzda kadar).
examples: He is as tall as his father.
He is not so fast as his brother.

content.rule: as many/much ... noun ... as | so many/much ... noun ... as (olumsuz).
examples: She has as many books as I do.
I don’t have so much time as you.

content.rule: Such ... adj + noun ... as (kadar).
examples: I have never seen such beautiful paintings as these.

content.title: So ... That
content.rule: So + adj/adv + that + SVO (o kadar ... ki).
examples: The test was so difficult that many students failed.

content.rule: So + many/much + noun + that + SVO.
examples: He had so many problems that he couldn't sleep.

content.title: Such ... That
content.rule: Such + (a/an) + adj + noun + that + SVO.
examples: It was such a boring movie that we left early.

content.rule: Such + a lot of + noun + that + SVO.
examples: They gave us such a lot of food that we couldn’t eat it all.

content.title: Too & Enough
content.rule: Too + adj/adv + to V0 (emeyecek kadar ...).
examples: The tea is too hot to drink.

content.rule: Too many/much + noun + to V0.
examples: There are too many tasks to complete.

content.rule: adj/adv + enough + to V0 / enough + noun + to V0.
examples: She is strong enough to lift the box.
We have enough money to buy a car.

content.rule: The ...-est (kısa kelimeler) / The most ... (uzun kelimeler).
examples: He is the tallest.
This is the most beautiful place.

content.title: Superlative İpuçları
content.rule: by far, of all, among, in gibi kelimeler superlative yapıya işaret eder.
examples: She is by far the best singer.
He is the most talented among his teammates.

content.rule: The least (en az) / At least (en azından).
examples: The least expensive option.
Sleep at least 7 hours.

content.rule: The last (en son - devamı yok) / The latest (en son - güncel, devamı var).
examples: The last person to leave.
The latest version of the app.

content.title: LIKE
content.rule: Like + noun (gibi).
examples: He plays the guitar like a professional.

content.title: SUCH AS
content.rule: Such as / like + noun (örnekleme).
examples: Water sports, such as swimming and diving.

content.title: AS
content.rule: As + noun (olarak) / As + SVO (çünkü, iken, -dıkça) / As V3 (edilgen yapı).
examples: He works as a teacher.
As it was raining, we stayed home.
As seen in the picture.

content.title: SUCH Kullanımı
content.rule: Such + noun (böyle) / Such + adj + noun + as (örnekleme).
examples: I’ve never seen such weather.
Such unhealthy foods as burgers.

content.rule: DİKKAT: Such as cümle başında KULLANILMAZ!
examples: ✅ I enjoy sports such as football.
❌ Such as football, I enjoy sports.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra yardımcı fiil, fiil veya modal geliyorsa (özne eksikse) kullanılır.

content.title: İnsan
content.rule: WHO / THAT (Virgül varsa sadece WHO)
examples: The man who called you is my uncle.
Mr. Smith, who is our teacher, is very kind.

content.title: Diğer (Cansız/Hayvan)
content.rule: WHICH / THAT (Virgül varsa sadece WHICH)
examples: The car that broke down is mine.
The plan, which seemed perfect, failed.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra 'özne + fiil' dizilimi geliyorsa (nesne eksikse) kullanılır.

content.title: İnsan
content.rule: WHOM / WHO / THAT (Virgül varsa WHOM veya WHO)
examples: The person whom you met was my cousin.
My friend, whom I trust, helped me.

content.title: Diğer (Cansız/Hayvan)
content.rule: WHICH / THAT
examples: The book which I read was amazing.
Her answer, which I didn’t expect, surprised me.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra 'noun' veya 'adj + noun' geliyorsa kullanılır.

content.title: İnsan & Diğer
content.rule: WHOSE
examples: The girl whose brother is a doctor.
The house whose windows are broken was sold.

content.title: Cansızlar için Alternatif
content.rule: the + noun + of which
examples: The building the roof of which collapsed is unsafe.

content.title: Yer (Place)
content.rule: WHERE / PREP + WHICH / WHICH (yarım cümleyle) / WHOSE + noun
examples: which + SV/VO: The city which hosts many tourists is Rome.
where + SVO (tam cümle): The restaurant where we ate was excellent.
prep + which + SVO: The city in which we live is noisy.
whose + noun: Istanbul, whose streets are crowded...

content.title: Zaman (Time)
content.rule: WHEN / WHICH / PREP + WHICH
examples: The moment when he arrived was magical.
The day which followed the storm was calm.

content.title: Sebep (Reason)
content.rule: WHY / WHICH / THAT
examples: The reason why she left is unknown.
The reason that she gave was logical.

content.title: PREP + Relative Pronoun
content.rule: Boşluk başında edat (prep) varsa sadece şunlar gelebilir: WHOM (insan için), WHICH (cansız için), WHOSE + noun.
examples: The woman to whom I spoke.
The book about which we talked.

content.title: WHEREBY
content.rule: WHEREBY / BY MEANS OF WHICH + SVO (aracılığıyla / vasıtasıyla anlamı katar).
examples: They signed an agreement whereby both sides benefit.

content.title: Aktif & Pasif Kısaltmalar
content.rule: Aktif: Noun + Ving | Pasif: Noun + V3 | Pasif (devam eden): Noun + being V3.
examples: Aktif: The boy playing the guitar...
Pasif: The car repaired yesterday...
Pasif (Sürekli): The files being uploaded...

content.title: Özel Kısaltmalar
content.rule: Superlative / The first / The only + to V0 (aktif) veya to be V3 (pasif).
examples: The best player to join...
The best house to be built...

content.title: Sıfat ve Edat ile Kısaltma
content.rule: Noun + ADJ | Noun + PREP
examples: A girl angry at her mom...
The person in charge...

NOUN CLAUSES.topic: Kararlı Durum Bağlaçları (That / The Fact That)

content.title: Özne Konumunda
content.rule: That + cümlecik + V + O | The fact that + cümlecik + V + O
examples: That she passed surprised us.
The fact that he lied shocked me.

content.title: Özne Konumu Dışında
content.rule: S + V + that + SVO | S + yardımcı fiil + that + SVO
examples: I know that she is here.
He didn't say that he knew it.

content.title: Pasif, Sıfat ve İsim Sonrası
content.rule: It + pasif + that | sıfat + that | soyut isim + that | prep + the fact that
examples: It is believed that he left.
I’m glad that you came.
The hope that he survives is strong.
They reacted to the fact that he resigned.

NOUN CLAUSES.topic: Kararsız Durum Bağlaçları (Wh-, How, Whether, If)

content.rule: S + V + Wh- / How / Whether / If + SVO
examples: I wonder what she wants.
He didn’t know how it works.

content.rule: It is unclear whether... / I’m not sure if...
examples: It is unclear whether he’ll return.
I’m not sure if he knows.

content.rule: Edattan (prep) sonra IF gelmez, Wh- veya How gelir.
examples: They talked about how she succeeded.

content.rule: Özne konumunda ise ⇒ WHETHER
examples: Whether she agrees is unknown.

content.rule: Edattan (prep) hemen sonra ise ⇒ WHETHER
examples: I’m thinking about whether we should go.

content.rule: or not'dan hemen önce ise ⇒ WHETHER
examples: They asked whether or not we will apply.

content.rule: Mastarlı kısaltmalarda (to V0) ⇒ WHETHER
examples: They haven’t decided whether to stay.

content.rule: Fiilden sonra her ikisi de olabilir.
examples: I don’t know whether she will come.
I don’t know if she will come.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra 'adj/adv + S + V' geliyorsa ⇒ HOW
examples: I’m amazed how fast she ran.

content.rule: Boşluktan sonra 'noun + S + V' geliyorsa ⇒ whose, which, what, how many/much
examples: Which car she bought surprised us.

content.rule: Özne eksikse (Boşluk + fiil/modal) ⇒ who, what, which, how many/much
examples: What caused the fire is unknown.

content.rule: Nesne eksikse (Boşluk + S + V) ⇒ who, whom, what, which, how many/much
examples: She met whoever you invited.

content.rule: Cümle tam ise (Boşluk + S + V + O) ⇒ that, the fact that, whether/if, where, when, why, how
examples: I don’t know where she lives.

content.title: ASLA OLMAZ (Ana Cümlede)
content.rule: had said, Ving, would say, will say + that...
examples: He will say that she is guilty. ❌

content.title: OLABİLİR (Ana Cümlede)
content.rule: have suggested, suggest, suggested + that...
examples: They suggested that we leave early. ✅

content.title: Eklemeler (Too, Either, So, Neither)
content.rule: -. - , either | . +, too / as well | So (devrik) | Neither .. nor (tekil/çoğul uyumu)
examples: She doesn’t like coffee, and I don’t either.
He likes music, and I do too.
She is tired, and so am I.
Neither Tom nor Jerry was late.

content.title: Question Tags (Aydın Hoca Notu)
content.rule: Cümle olumluysa tag olumsuz, olumsuzsa tag olumludur. Aynı modal/yardımcı fiil kullanılır.
examples: You’re coming, aren’t you?
She can’t swim, can she?

content.title: Type 0 (Genel Doğrular)
content.rule: V1 , V1
examples: If you heat ice, it melts.

content.title: Type 1 (Gerçekleşebilir)
content.rule: V1 , will/shall V0
examples: If it rains, we will stay at home.

content.title: Type 2 (Hayali - Şimdiki Zaman)
content.rule: V2 , would (be) V0
examples: If I had time, I would help you.

content.title: Type 3 (Hayali - Geçmiş Zaman)
content.rule: had V3 , would have V3
examples: If she had studied, she would have passed.

content.title: Past Condition / Present Result
content.rule: had V3 , would (be) V0
examples: If I had slept earlier, I would be energetic now.

content.title: Present Condition / Past Result
content.rule: V2 , would have V3
examples: If I were taller, I would have joined the team.

content.title: If'li Kısımda Olmazlar
content.rule: will, shall, may, might, could, be going to kesinlikle gelmez.
examples: If you will come, call me. ❌

content.title: Sonuç (Diğer) Kısmında Olmazlar
content.rule: have V3, V2, was/were, had V3, am/is/are, am/is/are Ving bu kısımda tek başına bulunmaz.
examples: If you come, I have seen her. ❌

content.rule: provided that / on condition that (şartıyla)
examples: You can go out provided that you finish homework.

content.rule: as long as / so long as (-dığı sürece)
examples: You can stay as long as you keep quiet.

content.rule: only if (ancak ... olursa)
examples: He will join us only if he finishes early.

content.rule: even if (-sa bile)
examples: I'll go even if it rains.

content.rule: unless (-mazsa / -madıkça)
examples: You’ll fail unless you study.

content.rule: whether .. or (ister ... ister)
examples: We’ll go whether it rains or not.

content.rule: just in case (olur diye / ne olur ne olmaz)
examples: Take an umbrella just in case it rains.

content.rule: in case of (durumunda)
examples: In case of fire, use the stairs.

CONDITIONALS & WISH.topic: Özel Koşul Yapıları (If it weren't for / But for)

content.rule: if it weren’t for / if it hadn’t been for (olmasaydı)
examples: If it weren’t for her help, I would fail.

content.rule: but for / without (-olmasaydı / -olmasa)
examples: But for your warning, I would have missed the bus.
I wouldn’t succeed without your support.

content.rule: but, otherwise, or else, or
examples: I would go, but I’m too tired.
You must study; otherwise, you'll fail.
Leave now, or else you'll miss the train.

content.rule: supposed to / what if
examples: You are supposed to wear a helmet.
What if she doesn’t come?

content.rule: Wish cümleleri daima 'bi tık geçmiş' zamanı kullanır.

content.title: Present Wish (Şu anki istek)
content.rule: V2 / would V0 / could V0
examples: I wish I knew the answer.
I wish he would call me.

content.title: Past Wish (Geçmiş pişmanlık)
content.rule: had V3 / would have V3 / could have V3
examples: I wish I had studied harder.
I wish you would have told me.

content.rule: Wish'ten sonra present (V1) veya future (will) yapılar asla gelmez.
examples: I wish I am rich. ❌

content.rule: Özne aynıysa 'would' kullanılmaz.
examples: I wish I would pass the exam. ❌

content.title: If Only
content.rule: Wish ile aynı mantıktadır.
examples: If only I hadn’t said that.

content.title: FANBOYS
content.rule: SVO + fanboys + SVO | SVO + n + VSO (devrik)

content.title: BAĞLAÇLAR
content.rule: X SVO , SVO | SVO X SVO | SVO , X SVO

content.title: CÜMLE ZARFLARI
content.rule: SVO. X , SVO | SVO : X ; SVO | SVO, X SVO | SVO. SVO , X | SVO. S , X , VO | SVO. S, X.

content.title: EDATLAR
content.rule: X N.P/NC/Ving , SVO | SVO X N.P/NC/Ving

content.title: FANBOYS
content.rule: for, and, nor, then, but, or, yet, so
examples: He left early, for he had an appointment.
She bought a book and read it in one day.
He doesn’t smoke, nor does he drink.
He is old, yet very strong.

content.title: Paralel Yapılar
content.rule: not only .. but also | both .. and | either .. or | neither .. nor | not .. but
examples: She speaks not only English but also French.
He is both smart and hardworking.
It’s not a bug but a feature.

content.title: Bağlaçlar (SVO)
content.rule: although, even though, much as, even if, while, though, despite the fact that, in spite of the fact that, whereas
examples: Although it was cold, we went out.
Much as I admire him, I disagree.
She likes cats, whereas he prefers dogs.

content.title: Edatlar (Noun/Ving)
content.rule: despite, in spite of, in contrast to/with, unlike, contrary to
examples: Despite the rain, we went out.
Unlike you, I enjoy hiking.
Contrary to expectations, he passed.

content.title: Cümle Zarfları
content.rule: however, still, even so, nonetheless, nevertheless, all the same, conversely, on the other hand, in contrast, by contrast
examples: It was difficult. However, he did it.
She was tired. Still, she helped.
The old model was slow. By contrast, the new one is fast.

content.title: Özel Kullanım
content.rule: however + adj/adv | no matter how + adj/adv
examples: However hard he tried, he couldn’t win.
No matter how fast you run, you’ll be late.

content.title: Sebep Bağlaçları (SVO)
content.rule: because, since, as, seeing as, seeing that, inasmuch as, on the grounds that, now that, in that
examples: Seeing as you’re here, let’s start.
He’s lucky in that he got support.

content.title: Sebep Edatları (Noun/Ving)
content.rule: because of, due to, owing to, on account of, in view of, thanks to, as a result of, as a consequence of
examples: The flight was delayed due to fog.
In view of the evidence, he’s guilty.
Thanks to you, I passed.

content.title: Sonuç Yapıları
content.rule: so .. that, such .. that, so (that), otherwise, therefore, thus, hence, accordingly, consequently, as a consequence, as a result, thereby
examples: She was so tired that she fell asleep.
He lied, thus losing our trust.
He apologized, thereby ending the argument.

content.title: Zaman Bağlaçları
content.rule: after, before, as soon as, the moment, when, while, once, until / till, by the time, just as, the last time, the next time, no sooner than, hardly when, whenever, every time
examples: The moment he saw her, he smiled.
By the time we got there, they had left.
No sooner had he arrived than he left.

content.title: Zaman Zarfları
content.rule: at first / initially, afterwards, in the mean time, meanwhile
examples: At first, I didn’t understand.
You cook; in the meantime, I’ll set the table.

content.title: Amaç Bağlaçları
content.rule: so that, in order that, for fear that, lest
examples: Take notes so that you can remember.
He hid the letter lest anyone should see it.

content.title: Ekleme Cümle Zarfları
content.rule: also, besides, further, moreover, furthermore, in addition, what's more
examples: He’s smart; moreover, he’s kind.

content.title: Ekleme Edatları
content.rule: besides, in addition to, apart from, as well as, aside from, along with, together with, alongside, coupled with
examples: She paints as well as writes.
Aside from one mistake, it’s good.

content.title: Örnekleme & Özelleştirme
content.rule: for instance, for example, to illustrate, in particular, particularly, especially, notably, specifically
examples: I love movies, in particular, thrillers.
Many cities, notably Paris, are beautiful.

content.title: Vurgu & Benzetme
content.rule: in fact, indeed, actually, as a matter of fact, as such, likewise, similarly, on the contrary
examples: He’s not lazy; in fact, he works a lot.
He’s not rude; on the contrary, he’s polite.
He worked hard; likewise, his team did too.

content.title: Hakkında / -e gelince
content.rule: as for, when it comes to, with regard to, with respect to, in the case of, about, as to, concerning, regarding, as regards, pertaining to
examples: As for the test, I think I passed.
When it comes to cooking, she’s the best.
A law concerning animals was passed.

content.title: Durum & Öznel Yargı
content.rule: just as, as if / as though, given that / considering that, given / considering, as far as / so far as
examples: She talks as if she knew everything.
Given that he’s new, he did well.
As far as I know, he’s innocent.

content.title: Hariç Tutma
content.rule: except that, save that, except (for), but, apart from, saving
examples: Everyone came except (for) Tim.
No one but her survived.

content.title: Aracılığıyla
content.rule: by, via, through, by means of, with the help of
examples: We sent the package via courier.
He communicated by means of sign language.
She succeeded with the help of her mentor.

content.title: Bakılmaksızın & Tercih
content.rule: irrespective of, regardless of, rather than, instead / rather, instead of
examples: It applies irrespective of age.
He walked rather than drove.
We chose coffee instead of tea.

content.title: Özetleme
content.rule: in summary, in brief, in short, in conclusion, to sum up, to wrap up, all in all
examples: In conclusion, the results are promising.
All in all, it was a success.
